sen.j: しおじプラザとは、京都府舞鶴市浜にある海浜公園。
sen.e: Shioji Plaza is a seaside park on the beachside of Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shioji Plaza is a seaside park on the beachside of Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Shioji Plaza is a seaside park on the beachside of Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The construction of the first section was completed in 1993.
The construction of the first section was completed in 1993.
The construction of the first section was completed in 1993.

sen.j: 東舞鶴地区の中心部から、すぐ近くにある海辺の公園である。
sen.e: Shioji Plaza is a park on the beachside, close to the center of Higashi-maizuru district.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shioji Plaza is a park on the beachside, close to the center of Higashi-maizuru district.
Shioji Plaza is a park on the beachside, close to the center of Higashi-maizuru district.

sen.j: 三条通 (曖昧さ回避)から五条通までの約3,500m²の間に、ツツジやサツキなどの花木約3,000本が植えられている。
sen.e: About 3,000 flowers and trees such as tsutsuji azaleas and satsuki azaleas have been planted in the area, approximately 3,500m², from Sanjo-dori Street (disambiguation) to Gojo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: About 3,000 flowers and trees such as tsutsuji azaleas and satsuki azaleas have been planted in the area of approximately 3,500m² from Sanjo-dori Street (disambiguation) to Gojo-dori Street.
About 3,000 flowers and trees such as tsutsuji azaleas and satsuki azaleas have been planted in the area of approximately 3,500m² from Sanjo-dori Street (disambiguation) to Gojo-dori Street.

sen.j: 公園内では、花木の散策が楽しめる。
sen.e: Many people enjoy strolling along and viewing the trees and flowers inside the park.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many people enjoy taking a walk and viewing the trees and flowers in the park.
Many people enjoy taking a walk and viewing the trees and flowers in the park.

sen.j: ほかに、青銅の彫刻像などや、ベンチが設置されている。
sen.e: Also the park has bronze sculptures and benches.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also the park has bronze sculptures and benches.
Also the park has bronze sculptures and benches.

sen.j: 天気の良い日は、海を挟んで目前にフェリーの発着する前島埠頭、その先に大浦半島の山並みなどが見渡せる、多くの人がくつろぐスポットとなっている。
sen.e: When the weather is good, across the ocean you can see Maejima Wharf, where ferries arrive and depart, and further beyond the mountains in Oura Peninsula, and therefore many people like to relax there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When the weather is good, one can enjoy the view of Maejima Wharf and ferries depart and arrive by as well as the mountains in Oura Peninsula over the sea, which has been a good spot to relax for many people.

When the weather is good, one can enjoy the view of Maejima Wharf and ferries depart and arrive by as well as the mountains in Oura Peninsula over the sea, which has been a good spot to relax for many people.

sen.j: また、公園内の中央にある大きな錨のモニュメントは、第二次世界大戦前につくられた航路標識係留用のものである。
sen.e: Also in the center of the park there is a monument of a large anchor, which was made before World War II to moor a beacon.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also in the center of the park, there is a monument of a large anchor, which was built before World War II to moor a beacon.
Also in the center of the park, there is a monument of a large anchor, which was built before World War II to moor a beacon.

sen.j: 重さが約4トンあり、公園のシンボルとして市が海上自衛隊から借り受けて設置したものである。
sen.e: The monument weighs about four tons, and was borrowed from the Maritime Self-Defense Force and placed there by the city as the symbol of the park.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The monument weighs about four tons, and was borrowed from the Maritime Self-Defense Force and placed there by the city as the symbol of the park.
The monument weighs about four tons, and was borrowed from the Maritime Self-Defense Force and placed there by the city as the symbol of the park.

sen.j: なお、岸壁には、舞鶴湾を巡る舞鶴港遊覧船の発着場がある。
sen.e: There is a landing place on the quay for Maizuru Port Pleasure Boats which cruise Maizuru Bay.
There is a landing place on the quay for Maizuru Port Pleasure Boats which cruise Maizuru Bay.
There is a landing place on the quay for Maizuru Port Pleasure Boats which cruise Maizuru Bay.

sen.j: ちなみに、第二期工事として、フェリー乗り場のある前島埠頭とを結ぶ歩道橋の設置が計画されているが、建設の見通しは立っていない。
sen.e: Incidentally there is a plan to install a pedestrian overpass connecting the park to Maejima Wharf, which has a ferry landing place, as the second phase of the construction, however the outlook for the construction is still uncertain.

Incidentally, there is a plan to install a pedestrian overpass connecting the park to Maejima Wharf, which has a ferry landing place, as the second phase of the construction, however, the outlook for the construction is still uncertain.

Incidentally, there is a plan to install a pedestrian overpass connecting the park to Maejima Wharf, which has a ferry landing place, as the second phase of the construction, however, the outlook for the construction is still uncertain.
